Devil's Pass
Holly Goss  (Actor),     Matt Stokoe  (Actor),     Renny Harlin  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    R    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Science Fiction & Fantasy, Fantasy
["In February of 1959, nine Russian hikers ventured into a remote area of the Ural Mountains. Two weeks later, all of them were found dead. What happened is a mystery that has baffled investigators and researchers for decades. It has become known as the Dyatlov Pass Incident. When five ambitious American college students are issued a grant to return to the site of the original events, they gear up with the belief that they can uncover and document the truth of what happened to the supposedly experienced hikers. But what they find is more shocking than anything they could have imagined. Retracing the steps of the Russians' ill-fated journey, the students are plagued by strange and increasingly terrifying phenomena that suggest that in spite of the desolate surroundings, they are not alone. The forces at work in the Dyatlov Pass Incident have been waiting for them. Based on a true story, director Renny Harlin's (Cliffhanger) DEVIL'S PASS is an edge-of-your-seat thriller that delivers nail-biting suspense right up to it's shocking final frame."]
{'Genre': 'Horror', 'Format': 'NTSC, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Renny Harlin, Holly Goss, Matt Stokoe', 'Language': 'English', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 40 minutes', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'R (Restricted)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.72 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'IDFC9895DVD', 'Director': 'Renny Harlin', 'Media Format': 'NTSC, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 40 minutes', 'Release date': 'December 17, 2013', 'Actors': 'Holly Goss, Matt Stokoe', 'Studio': 'IFC Independent Film', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'}

The Wings of Eagles
John Wayne  (Actor),     Dan Dailey  (Actor),     John Ford  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Today's Deals, Featured Deals & New Releases, Warner Sale
['Wings Of Eagles, The (DVD) (Commemorative Amaray)', 'John Wayne, Dan Dailey, and Maureen O\'Hara star in one of John Ford\'s most personal films, in which he pays tribute to a man he knew and admired in real life, pioneering World War I naval aviator Frank "Spig" Wead. Although Wead (Wayne) is instrumental in advancing the cause of American air power, he endures a troubled personal life, becoming estranged from his wife, Minnie (O\'Hara) after the death of their baby. During a bout of drinking, he tumbles down the stairs of his home and is paralyzed. With the help of happy-go-lucky Navy mechanic "Jughead" Carson (Dailey), Wead regains some use of his legs and eventually restores meaning to his life. The film was shot on location at the Naval Air Station in Pensacola, Florida, using real Navy men as extras.', ']]>']
{'Genre': 'Documentary, Military & War', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, NTSC, Closed-captioned, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Contributor': "Ward Bond, Dan Dailey, Charles Schnee, Ken Curtis, Edmund Lowe, Frank Wead, John Wayne, Kenneth Tobey, Frank Fenton, William Wister Haines, John Ford, James E Newcom, Maureen O'HaraWard Bond, Dan Dailey, Charles Schnee, Ken Curtis, Edmund Lowe, Frank Wead, John Wayne, Kenneth Tobey, Frank Fenton, William Wister Haines, John Ford, James E Newcom, Maureen O'Hara  See more", 'Initial release date': '2007-05-22', 'Language': 'Unqualified, English (Mono)', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.75 x 5.75 x 0.53 inches; 2.4 Ounces', 'Item model number': '79863', 'Director': 'John Ford', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, NTSC, Closed-captioned, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 50 minutes', 'Release date': 'May 22, 2007', 'Actors': "John Wayne, Dan Dailey, Maureen O'Hara, Ward Bond, Ken Curtis", 'Subtitles': 'French, Spanish, English', 'Producers': 'Charles Schnee, James E Newcom', 'Studio': 'Studio Distribution Services', 'Writers': 'Frank Fenton, William Wister Haines, Frank Wead', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'}
John Wayne, what can you say, if your a fan then you know there's none better for entertaining on the screen. A biography of Frank "Spig" Wead, Naval Aviator directed by Rear Admiral John Ford, its exciting, fast paced and action pacted, just what we've come to expect in the "Duke". A great supporting role by Dan Dailey. A treat that's worth a look. Thanks.

profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary:**

- **Genre Preferences:** The user maintains a strong interest in suspenseful and dramatic narratives, particularly in crime and justice themes, while continuing to appreciate horror elements with a critical perspective on niche horror films. Their recent exploration of biographical narratives highlights an openness to new genres, contingent on quality.

- **Content Preferences:** They favor fast-paced storytelling that tackles darker themes and realism, though their critical stance on production and acting quality persists. The latest review reveals dissatisfaction with a sci-fi/fantasy film, demonstrating a low tolerance for narratives that confuse rather than engage, reinforcing their demand for coherent, entertaining storytelling.

- **Rating Trends:** The user typically rates around 4 stars but has shown increasing scrutiny across genres, particularly horror. Their recent engagement indicates a notable drop in rating to 1 star due to an unengaging plot, pointing to a more stringent evaluation of narrative clarity and depth.

- **Language and Subtitles:** Preferring English content, the necessity of subtitles for thorough narrative comprehension remains evident.

Overall, the user seeks thrilling, action-driven films with substantial character development and depth while raising their standards for coherence and enjoyment in all viewing experiences, especially in new genre explorations.
